data.title: installer in 0525 created wrong shortcut
data.body:
I did install into a new folder, also changed name on the menu shortcut  The run file did not link correctly, but the editor did.

the openra game shortcut in the menu points to this: "C:\Program Files (x86)\OpenRA2014005\lua\OpenRA.G

and the editor points to this: "C:\Program Files (x86)\OpenRA2014005\OpenRA.Editor.exe"

data.title: OpenBSD Support?
data.body:
Hi,

Should OpenRA work on OpenBSD? It builds fine, but fails to run (both release and git HEAD). 

Here is what I get on the latest release:

```
wilfred:OpenRA-release-20131223> mono OpenRA.Game.exe        
Platform is Linux
Using SDL 1.2 with OpenGL renderer
Desktop resolution: 1366x768
No custom resolution provided, using desktop resolution
Using resolution: 1366x768
Renderer initialization failed. Fallback in place. Check graphics.log for details.
Using SDL 2 with OpenGL renderer
Renderer initialization failed. Fallback in place. Check graphics.log for details.
Using SDL 1.2 with OpenGL renderer
Desktop resolution: 1366x768
No custom resolution provided, using desktop resolution
Using resolution: 1366x768
Renderer initialization failed. Fallback in place. Check graphics.log for details.
Using SDL 1.2 with Cg renderer
Desktop resolution: 1366x768
No custom resolution provided, using desktop resolution
Using resolution: 1366x768
Renderer initialization failed. Fallback in place. Check graphics.log for details.
Exception of type `System.InvalidOperationException`: No suitable renderers were found. Check graphics.log for details.
  at OpenRA.Game.Initialize (OpenRA.Arguments args) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Program.Run (System.String[] args) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Program.Main (System.String[] args) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
Exception of type `System.NullReferenceException`: Object reference not set to an instance of an object
  at OpenRA.Program.FatalError (System.Exception e) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Program.Main (System.String[] args) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
exception inside UnhandledException handler: Object reference not set to an instance of an object

[ERROR] FATAL UNHANDLED EXCEPTION: System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object
  at OpenRA.Program.FatalError (System.Exception e) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Program.Main (System.String[] args) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
wilfred:OpenRA-release-20131223> find . -name 'graphics.log'
wilfred:OpenRA-release-20131223>
```

A black screen flashes up quickly before disappearing. Something in SDL failed perhaps? No `graphics.log` was emitted...

Here is what I get on git HEAD:

```
wilfred:OpenRA> mono OpenRA.Game.exe        
Platform is Linux
Using SDL 2 with OpenGL renderer
Renderer initialization failed. Fallback in place. Check graphics.log for details.
Using SDL 2 with OpenGL renderer
Renderer initialization failed. Fallback in place. Check graphics.log for details.
Exception of type `System.InvalidOperationException`: No suitable renderers were found. Check graphics.log for details.
  at OpenRA.Game.Initialize (OpenRA.Arguments args) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Program.Run (System.String[] args) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Program.Main (System.String[] args) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
Exception of type `System.NullReferenceException`: Object reference not set to an instance of an object
  at OpenRA.Program.FatalError (System.Exception e) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Program.Main (System.String[] args) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
exception inside UnhandledException handler: Object reference not set to an instance of an object

[ERROR] FATAL UNHANDLED EXCEPTION: System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object
  at OpenRA.Program.FatalError (System.Exception e) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Program.Main (System.String[] args) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
wilfred:OpenRA> find . -name 'graphics.log' 
```

Looks like it is trying to use SDL2, which isn't ready on OpenBSD yet.

FWIW, OpenBSD uses Xorg:

```
wilfred:~> X -version

X.Org X Server 1.15.1
Release Date: 2014-04-13
X Protocol Version 11, Revision 0
Build Operating System: OpenBSD 5.5 amd64 
Current Operating System: OpenBSD wilfred.dlink.com 5.5 GENERIC.MP#142 amd64
Build Date: 23 May 2014  01:38:21AM

Current version of pixman: 0.32.4
        Before reporting problems, check http://wiki.x.org
        to make sure that you have the latest version.
```

My graphics card is:

```
vga1 at pci0 dev 2 function 0 "Intel HD Graphics 4000" rev 0x09
```

Here are my SDL, OpenAL and mono versions:

```
wilfred:~> pkg_info | grep -E 'mono-2|sdl|openal'          
mono-2.10.9p3       cross platform, open source .NET developement framework
openal-1.15.1v0     cross-platform 3D audio API
sdl-1.2.15p6        cross-platform multimedia library
sdl-mixer-1.2.12p2  SDL multi-channel audio mixer library
sdl-net-1.2.8p1     SDL cross-platform networking library
```

Cheers

<bountysource-plugin>

---

Want to back this issue? **[Place a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/2334511-openbsd-support?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Infantry Speed walking.
data.body:
Glitch in playtest-20140405-2 where you use either the Chinook Helicopter or APC unit to speed walk infantry.

Mass right clicking on the unit will cause the infantry to jump towards its target each time ignoring terrain tile sets to reach their destination. This was tested on Minigunners with APCs and Chinook Helicopter.

This glitch doesnt exist in the final release build.

Tested in TD

data.title: Revert project file changes
data.body:
Revert project file changes by RoosterDragon which would cause the TD mod to fail to load for some reason on Windows (de7a837d941968368ff0c8b87b6ca02df4c96a88, #5403).
VS will also generate a warning if it tries to source an icon from somewhere not in the project directory, so added it to the CrashDialog folder.

If someone can come up with a proper fix for this crash I'm happy to take that instead.
Closes #5439

data.title: KOTH map crash
data.body:
G'day guys, Adelric again. So, you guys know that I'm working on a mod. But I've run into yet another snag, when I try to launch a KOTH game. OpenRA crashes and returns a fatal error. Which will be attached, it appears I'm missing an actor?

data.title: Fixed frozen actors not visible under fog
data.body: A regression introduced by https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/5433 as described in https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/5437.

data.title: Revert "Move cnc perf graph out of the way of the news button"
data.body:
This reverts commit 8fc387065671eb370df72d8ebb5929656f9609a2.

Closes #5438

data.title: Tile Builder Image stretching (DPI)
data.body:
I've had this problem for a while then realized the cause is I changed the DPI for my computers font which caused the image to stretch:
http://i.imgur.com/Rk0kiXX.jpg

To replicate, in Windows Vista (And above) go into Control Panel\All Control Panel Items\Display then Set Custom Text size (DPI) to something like 110% and then restart/log off and back in. You'll notice the stretching on the TIle Builder's loaded image when you place a few tiles.
Side note, I've never had this sort of problem with using an increased DPI before except for text bleeding off of windows.

data.title: Perf text without the perf graph looks bad in the TD menu.
data.body: Introduced by #5279.  We can change back to the old positioning now that #5419 has adjusted the news.

data.title: Buildings are no longer frozen under fog
data.body: Broken by #5433.

data.title: Normal damage model & Spread are too unflexible
data.body:
I think #5120 showed a limitation of the current Normal damage model/Spread logic.

For a weapon like the Ion Cannon, you want maximum damage at the targeted cell, high damage at the 8 directly adjacent cells, maybe some very low damage at the outer border and then no damage at all about ~4 cells away from impact.

With DamageModel.Normal, that's currently next to impossible. Set a lower Spread value, and the area damage falls off too quickly, set it higher and the area that receives damage becomes rather large.

What I'd propose is to add something like SpreadDamageFactor and MaxSpread settings to Warhead. SpreadDamageFactor would allow the modder to set a custom damage falloff multiplicator for every spread step (even allowing both decreasing and increasing damage), and MaxSpread would set an outer border at which damage is cut off completely regardless of the Spread value. This would give modders much more control over how exactly spread damage should behave, and would make fixing issues like #5120 much easier.

data.title: Fixed RA camo pillbox desert art and aircraft selection boxes
data.body: Closes #4796 and #5208.

data.title: Docking point of airfields etc. is not customizable

Landing aircraft always land at CenterPosition.

data.title: Reduce memory allocations in the main loop.
data.body:
# Memory

I targeted some methods allocating memory in the main loop and tweaked them. They function the same - just with less allocations.

Tested in RA for 2 ingame minutes on a 4 player map with 4 rush bots.
## Before

1218 MiB allocated in total

| Method | Allocated (MiB) |
| --- | --: |
| Actor.Render | 45 |
| FrozenUnderFog.Tick | 112 |
| FrozenActor.Tick | 112 |
| Widget.GetEventBounds | 31 |
| Animation.Render | 66 |
| MobileInfo.CanEnterCell | 2 |
| _HardwarePalette.ApplyModifiers_ | 86 |
| _PerfTimer overhead in DoTimed_ | 500 |

The latter two methods I didn't alter in this PR, but they're useful to include as a reference point.
## After

939 MiB allocated in total

| Method | Allocated (MiB) |
| --- | --: |
| Actor.Render | 0 |
| FrozenUnderFog.Tick | 0 |
| FrozenActor.Tick | 0 |
| Widget.GetEventBounds | 0 |
| Animation.Render | 31 |
| MobileInfo.CanEnterCell | 0 |
| _HardwarePalette.ApplyModifiers_ | 91 |
| _PerfTimer overhead in DoTimed_ | 474 |

Of the methods I targeted that's 368 MiB reduced to 31 MiB.
# CPU

As a pleasant side effect this also reduced the CPU time spent in some methods.

Tested in RA for 8 ingame minutes on a 4 player map with 4 rush bots.
## Before

| Method | Relative Time (%) |
| --- | --: |
| Actor.Render | 2.46 |
| FrozenUnderFog.Tick | 3.00 |
| FrozenActor.Tick | 2.24 |
| Widget.GetEventBounds | 0.82 |
| Animation.Render | 2.70 |
| MobileInfo.CanEnterCell | 1.11 |
| _HardwarePalette.ApplyModifiers_ | 5.23 |
| _PerfTimer overhead in DoTimed_ | 12.91 |
## After

| Method | Relative Time (%) |
| --- | --: |
| Actor.Render | 1.78 |
| FrozenUnderFog.Tick | 1.55 |
| FrozenActor.Tick | 0.51 |
| Widget.GetEventBounds | 0.09 |
| Animation.Render | 1.16 |
| MobileInfo.CanEnterCell | 0.77 |
| _HardwarePalette.ApplyModifiers_ | 4.43 |
| _PerfTimer overhead in DoTimed_ | 13.07 |

That's a reduction from 12.33% to 5.86%. There might also be some reduction in GC time since there's less garbage to collect - I have no numbers for that though.

As a quick aside, the PerfTimer change that resulted in its poor performance happened after I drafted up this set of changes hence why it's not in this PR. See #5408 for a change that should fix most of the allocation and some of the CPU time.

data.title: Fixed NullReferenceException when there are no replays
data.body: Followup of https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/5215.

data.title: Return to server list after disconnecting from a server
data.body: After disconnecting from a server or after a failed connection, the game returns to the main menu. It would be better if it returned back to the server list.

data.title: fixed a tib tree in Rogue States + polish
data.body:
Added a bit of decoration so the map looked less plain.

Please merge before next playtest, since the map is imbalanced due to lacking the tiberium tree.

data.title: Automatically refresh server list
data.body:
There should be a checkbox to toggle automatic refreshing of server list with a certain interval. Otherwise I have to constantly click refresh to see the current status. Or it could be even the default behavior without a checkbox.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/2322662-automatically-refresh-server-list?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Nuke radar ping doesn't disappear
data.body: Affects D2K at minimum

data.title: D2K repair overlay is offset incorrectly
Avoid a loop closure issue that caused incorrect sequence lookups.
data.body: Fixes a regression from #5234 that is only apparent on older compilers.

data.title: When creating game, does not say "connection with master server established"
data.body:
When I click "create game", it will always say,
"Server: Psydev has joined the server"

but it will very often NOT say:
"Server: Master server communication established"

I just noticed this behaviour within the last 2 weeks. So I will sit there and not realize that my game isn't being advertised. This happens maybe 25% of the time lately (typically only on the the first game creation, after starting the program).

The problem is solved when I cancel the game and create another one. But sometimes I sit there for a long time waiting for someone to join my game, without realizing that the game is not actually being advertised. It would be useful if OpenRA would produce some sort of warning message if it doesn't establish master server communication.

Side note: one time I left this going for many hours, and then spontaneously it popped up with "master server communication established". I was surprised by this and it was the first time I noticed the bug, realizing that for all that time it didn't return that message. This is the only time this has happened. Normally I will leave it for hours and not notice, and the message will never come. It usually only comes within a couple seconds or not at all.
